titleStmt.title: Isaiah Salyer, Allen Gullett, and Daniel Gullett, Affidavit
CWG11371

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Magoffin County } Sct.

We the undersigned citizens of Magoffin County state that we are aquanted with Soleman Back, and was acquainted with him at the time that he was fined in the Morgan Circuit for retailing spiritous liquor, $60 -- and that the said Back sold no whisky on his premises only such as he manufactured himself and that the indictment upon which he was fined was found upon the accusations of his selling Whiskey of his own manufacture --
April 25th 1862.

Isaiah Salyer
Allen Gullett
Daniel Gullett

State of Kentucky.
Magoffin County } Sct
Sworn to before me by -- Isaiah Salyer Allen Gullett and Daniel Gullett this 25th day of 1862 April 1862
Lewis Howard J P M C

Morgan Cir Ct
$60 } Tipling
Solm Back
Iss May 146th. 1862
